metadata.dc:comment:
The original dataset of the relative differential of the normalized burned ratio, RdNBR,
is one the datasets composing the global burn severity database (MOSEV database).
This was developed by based on Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) surface reflectance
and burned area (BA) products from November 2000 to near real time.
The original RdNBR product was classified into 5 categories to reflect the burned severity level:
-enhanced regrowth high and low, as well as nonburnt
-low severity
-moderate low severity
-moderate high severity
-high severity
The final maps represent the annual average burn severity level for each pixel, for each year
metadata.dc:title: Annualized Burned Severity Level from MODIS 2000
metadata.dc:creator: Rubén Crespo
metadata.dc:source: lonso-González, E. and Fernández-García, V.: MOSEV: a global burn severity database from MODIS (2000–2020), Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 13, 1925–1938
